column4: sudo apt-get install pastebinit  && cp /etc/fstab ~/Desktop/Partition_Layout.txt && sudo fdisk -l >> ~/Desktop/Partition_Layout.txt && lsb_release -a >> ~/Desktop/Partition_Layout.txt && cat /home/$USER/Desktop/Partition_Layout.txt | pastebinit  (Provide Pastebin link in channel)
all partitions mounted in /media will appear on the desktop.. change the mount point
it is just showing me some links to mount them, i don't want those links
look in /etc/fstab and see if they appear in there

To Remove Drive Icons from Desktop Use Terminal and type gconf-editor browse to /apps/nautilus/desktop and uncheck volumes_visable..  http://www.howtogeek.com/howto/ubuntu/hide-removable-drive-icons-from-your-ubuntu-desktop/
Also look to see what all you have in /media in the way of mounts
no, this not correct the issue
Sorry, ask again and see if someone knows or if I see the light
i opened nautilus through the places menu, then choosed computer, and they show me some links to mount the other partitions,
Do you ever want to see them..?
not those links, i just want to be able to acces the partitions in the /etc/fstab, but hardy allow me to mount any partition just placing those links
scroll down to the section in red
do you have other user accounts setup.. you could set tose partitions to just your user
for any user, even root, cause this linux is inside a virtual machine, and it is showing me some real partitions, if host os and this virtual linux access the same partition at the same time....
maybe that's what i need, thank you a lot
